text: <a href="../1-Chronicles-17-1/" title="1 Chronicles 17:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Now it came to pass, as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in an house of cedars, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD *remaineth* under curtains.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-2/" title="1 Chronicles 17:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Then Nathan said unto David, Do all that *is* in thine heart; for God *is* with thee.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-3/" title="1 Chronicles 17:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-4/" title="1 Chronicles 17:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith the LORD, Thou shalt not build me an house to dwell in:

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-5/" title="1 Chronicles 17:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 For I have not dwelt in an house since the day that I brought up Israel unto this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from *one* tabernacle *to another*.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-6/" title="1 Chronicles 17:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Wheresoever I have walked with all Israel, spake I a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me an house of cedars?

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-7/" title="1 Chronicles 17:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, *even* from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be ruler over my people Israel:

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-8/" title="1 Chronicles 17:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like the name of the great men that *are* in the earth.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-9/" title="1 Chronicles 17:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Also I will ordain a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the beginning,

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-10/" title="1 Chronicles 17:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And since the time that I commanded judges *to be* over my people Israel. Moreover I will subdue all thine enemies. Furthermore I tell thee that the LORD will build thee an house.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-11/" title="1 Chronicles 17:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And it shall come to pass, when thy days be expired that thou must go *to be* with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, which shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-12/" title="1 Chronicles 17:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 He shall build me an house, and I will stablish his throne for ever.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-13/" title="1 Chronicles 17:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took *it* from *him* that was before thee:

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-14/" title="1 Chronicles 17:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 But I will settle him in mine house and in my kingdom for ever: and his throne shall be established for evermore.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-15/" title="1 Chronicles 17:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-16/" title="1 Chronicles 17:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And David the king came and sat before the LORD, and said, Who *am* I, O LORD God, and what *is* mine house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-17/" title="1 Chronicles 17:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And *yet* this was a small thing in thine eyes, O God; for thou hast *also* spoken of thy servant's house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O LORD God.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-18/" title="1 Chronicles 17:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 What can David *speak* more to thee for the honour of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-19/" title="1 Chronicles 17:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 O LORD, for thy servant's sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all this greatness, in making known all *these* great things.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-20/" title="1 Chronicles 17:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 O LORD, *there is* none like thee, neither *is there any* God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-21/" title="1 Chronicles 17:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And what one nation in the earth *is* like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem *to be* his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out nations from before thy people, whom thou hast redeemed out of Egypt?

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-22/" title="1 Chronicles 17:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 For thy people Israel didst thou make thine own people for ever; and thou, LORD, becamest their God.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-23/" title="1 Chronicles 17:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 Therefore now, LORD, let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-24/" title="1 Chronicles 17:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 Let it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts *is* the God of Israel, *even* a God to Israel: and *let* the house of David thy servant *be* established before thee.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-25/" title="1 Chronicles 17:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 For thou, O my God, hast told thy servant that thou wilt build him an house: therefore thy servant hath found *in his heart* to pray before thee.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-26/" title="1 Chronicles 17:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:

<a href="../1-Chronicles-17-27/" title="1 Chronicles 17:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 Now therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O LORD, and *it shall be* blessed for ever.
